prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the top. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The model is centered in the image. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles for this coordinate system are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. Next, create the 2D sketch for this part. This sketch will be drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1), which contains a single loop (loop\\_1). The loop (loop\\_1) consists of 4 lines: 1. line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0695, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point [0.0695, 0.0], End Point [0.0695, 0.0099] 3. line\\_3: Start Point [0.0695, 0.0099], End Point [0.0, 0.0099] 4. line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0099], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Now, let's transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch scale parameter (0.0695). Then, use the euler angles and translation vector (defined in the coordinate system) to transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.75 and the extrude depth opposite normal to 0.0, using the sketch scale (0.0695) provided for this part. The final shape has dimensions of: - length: 0.0695 - width: 0.75 - height: 0.0695 Note that no boolean operation terms such as 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' have been used in these instructions. Instead, natural language descriptions have been provided to describe the operation of the current part with any preceding CAD models.</description>
